Title.evidence: A Randomised Controlled Trial Comparing Free Dermal Fat Graft and Superficial Musculoaponeurotic System Flap in Superficial Parotidectomy

Trial_Design.evidence: In a single-centre, prospective randomised controlled trial, 78 adult patients undergoing superficial conservative parotidectomy for benign indications were randomised into two groups using a closed envelope method.

Participants.evidence: 78 adult patients undergoing superficial conservative parotidectomy for benign indications

Intervention.evidence: One group received FDFG, and the other received SMAS flap.

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to compare the functional and aesthetic outcomes of free dermal fat graft (FDFG) and superficial musculoaponeurotic system (SMAS) flap in reducing these complications.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the development of Frey’s syndrome, assessed at 6 months postoperatively.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was concealed, and outcome assessors were blinded.

Blinding.evidence: Randomisation was concealed, and outcome assessors were blinded.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Seventy-eight patients were randomised equally between February 2016 and October 2021.

Number_Analysed.evidence: Seventy-eight patients were randomised equally between February 2016 and October 2021.

Result_Outcome.evidence: There was no significant difference in the development of Frey’s syndrome between the FDFG and SMAS groups.

Harms.evidence: No significant differences were found in demographic data, co-morbidities, parotid pathologies, specimen volumes, total operating time, or postoperative complications.
